hotelchain

Class TextInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • hotelchain.TextInterface
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GuestRegistrationTextInterface, HotelChainTextInterface

    public class TextInterface
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides basic functionality of a text-based user interface towards a HotelChain.
    Author:
    Joost Janssen

    • Method Detail

      • promptInputConfirmation

        protected boolean promptInputConfirmation(boolean printText)
        Presents a yes/no confirmation dialog.
        Parameters:
        printText - Indicates whether the dialog text is to be printed.
        Returns:
        Returns true or false as indicated by user input.

      • printOptions

        protected void printOptions(java.lang.String[] options,
                boolean printText)
        Presents a given list of valid user choice options. Last option in the list must be an exit option.
        Parameters:
        options - List of valid user choice options in String format.

      • getUserChoice

        protected int getUserChoice(int firstOption,
                int lastOption)
        Presents a user choice input dialog with a given valid choice range.
        Parameters:
        firstOption - Displayed value of first choice of valid choice range.
        lastOption - Displayed value of last choice of valid choice range.
        Returns:
        Returns the choice as indicated by user input. Returns -1 if no number was entered.

      • getUserInput

        protected java.lang.String getUserInput()
        Presents a user input dialog.
        Returns:
        Returns user input.

      • printHeader

        protected void printHeader(java.lang.String header)
        Prints a given header String between two short double lines.
        Parameters:
        header - Text to be printed as header.

      • print

        protected void print(java.lang.String string,
         java.lang.String border)
        Prints a given string surrounded by Strings "border". Extends to next line (within borders) if necessary.
        Parameters:
        string - String to print between borders.
        border - Border String.

      • printSingleLine

        protected void printSingleLine()
        Prints a single horizontal line to the screen, bordered by " | "s.

      • printDoubleLine

        protected void printDoubleLine()
        Prints a double horizontal line to the screen.

      • capitalize

        protected java.lang.String capitalize(java.lang.String string)
        Capitalizes every first letter of each word of a given String.
        Parameters:
        string - String to be capitalized.
        Returns:
        Returns a new String with each word's first letter Capitalized.
